SESSION_SUBTITLE: A focused discussion on advancing critical appraisal in medical research
PURPOSE_TEXT: The Journal Club aims to enhance residents' skills in critically appraising medical literature. By the session's conclusion, participants will be equipped to apply evidence-based insights to clinical practice effectively.
TOPIC_TEXT: Spinal versus General Anesthesia in Hip Surgery: Outcomes and Perioperative Care
OBJECTIVES_LIST: Develop critical appraisal skills using a structured checklist (validity, results, applicability).
Interpret effect sizes and confidence intervals beyond reliance on p-values.
Apply research findings to clinical vignettes relevant to anesthesia practice.
DISCUSSION_LIST: Was randomization adequate and allocation concealed?
Were baseline characteristics similar between groups?
Are the results clinically meaningful or just statistically significant?

ARTICLE_LIST.title: Long-term outcomes with spinal versus general anesthesia for hip fracture surgery
Pain, analgesic use, and satisfaction with spinal vs. general anesthesia

PREWORK_LIST: Prepare to discuss findings during the session.
AUTHOR: Brian Pitts, MD, MS
